intro: Borreria verbenoides var. thalictroides, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are clustered in terminal umbels. It is valued in landscaping for its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
